CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Eligible for Acquisition stage positioned above or below the Shortlisted for Acquisition stage?
SRP.A: The Eligible for Acquisition stage is positioned {below} the Shortlisted for Acquisition stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {exponential} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Eligible for Acquisition?
VE.A: The value of stage Eligible for Acquisition is {33%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Displayed in Exhibition?
VE.A: The value of stage Displayed in Exhibition is {55%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Institutionally Acquired?
VE.A: The value of stage Institutionally Acquired is {27%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Submitted for Review, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Institutionally Acquired, with a value of {27%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Approved for Exhibition to stage Displayed in Exhibition?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Approved for Exhibition to stage Displayed in Exhibition is {22%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Displayed in Exhibition to stage Shortlisted for Acquisition?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Displayed in Exhibition to stage Shortlisted for Acquisition is {18%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 88%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 35%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Eligible for Acquisition} stage has {33%}, the {Institutionally Acquired} stage has {27%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 35% and 46%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Displayed in Exhibition to Shortlisted for Acquisition, or from stage Shortlisted for Acquisition to Eligible for Acquisition?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Displayed in Exhibition} to {Shortlisted for Acquisition} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Approved for Exhibition to Displayed in Exhibition, or from stage Submitted for Review to Approved for Exhibition?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Submitted for Review} to {Approved for Exhibition} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Approved for Exhibition to Displayed in Exhibition, from stage Submitted for Review to Approved for Exhibition, or from stage Displayed in Exhibition to Shortlisted for Acquisition?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Submitted for Review} to stage {Approved for Exhibition} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Submitted for Review} and {Approved for Exhibition} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Shortlisted for Acquisition} and {Eligible for Acquisition} stages.
